title: Chargemap chargemap.com
summary: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could enable attackers to gain unauthorized administrative control over vulnerable charging stations or disrupt charging services through denial-of-service attacks. The following versions of Chargemap chargemap.com are affected: chargemap.com vers:all/* (CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s)) CVSS Vendor Equipment Vulnerabilities v3 9.4 Chargemap Chargemap chargemap.com Missing Authentication for Critical Function, Improper Restriction of Excessive Authentication Attempts, Insufficient Session Expiration, Insufficiently Protected Credentials Background Critical Infrastructure Sectors: Energy, Transportation Systems Countries/Areas Deployed: Worldwide Company Headquarters Location: France Vulnerabilities Expand All + CVE(s) WebSocket endpoints lack proper authentication mechanisms, enabling attackers to perform unauthorized station impersonation and manipulate data sent to the backend.

title: Yokogawa CENTUM VP R6, R7
summary: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to terminate the software stack process, cause a denial-of-service condition, or execute arbitrary code. The following versions of Yokogawa CENTUM VP R6, R7 are affected: Vnet/IP Interface Package for CENTUM VP R6 (VP6C3300) <=R1.07.00 (CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s)) Vnet/IP Interface Package for CENTUM VP R7 (VP7C3300) <=R1.07.00 (CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s)) CVSS Vendor Equipment Vulnerabilities v3 6.9 Yokogawa Yokogawa CENTUM VP R6, R7 Out-of-bounds Write, Reachable Assertion, Integer Underflow (Wrap or Wraparound), Improper Handling of Length Parameter Inconsistency Background Critical Infrastructure Sectors: Critical Manufacturing, Energy, Food and Agriculture Countries/Areas Deployed: Worldwide Company Headquarters Location: Japan Vulnerabilities Expand All + CVE(s) If the affected product receives maliciously crafted packets, a DoS attack may cause Vnet/IP communication functions to stop or arbitrary programs to be executed.

title: Copeland XWEB and XWEB Pro
summary: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to bypass authentication, cause a denial-of-service condition, cause memory corruption, and execute arbitrary code. The following versions of Copeland XWEB and XWEB Pro are affected: XWEB 300D PRO <=1.12.1 (CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s)) XWEB 500D PRO <=1.12.1 (CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s)) XWEB 500B PRO <=1.12.1 (CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s) CVE(s)) CVSS Vendor Equipment Vulnerabilities v3 10 Copeland Copeland XWEB and XWEB Pro Unexpected Status Code or Return Value, Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm, Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection'), Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal'), Stack-based Buffer Overflow Background Critical Infrastructure Sectors: Commercial Facilities Countries/Areas Deployed: Worldwide Company Headquarters Location: United States Vulnerabilities Expand All + CVE(s) A vulnerability exists in Copeland XWEB Pro version 1.12.1 and prior, in which an unexpected return value from the authentication routine is later on processed as a legitimate value, resulting in an authentication bypass.
